Class GameLogic

  • java.lang.Object
    • Hands
      • GameLogic
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GameGUI

    public class GameLogic
extends Hands
    Version:
    v2 Date: 27/04/2016; Description: This class is the game's logic. It checks win and loses after pressing hit or stand buttons.
    Author:
    Regson Do Rego

      GameLogic() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String checkBJorBust()
      This checks the user's hand to see if he has won or lost.
      void checkPush()
      Check if the dealer has a score of 21, if the dealer does then it is a draw (push).
      void checkWin()
      Checks if the dealer has won or lost.
      void dealerStand()
      When the stand button is pressed, this method will call the remaining cards that the dealer must have.
      void drawDealerStartHand()
      Draws the dealers 2 start cards
      void drawUserStartHand()
      Draws the user's 2 start cards
      void resetGame()
      Resets game back to start, clears arrays.

    • Method Detail

      • checkPush

        public void checkPush()
        Check if the dealer has a score of 21, if the dealer does then it is a draw (push). This method is only called once the player has 21 to confirm if he has won or a draw has occured.

      • checkWin

        public void checkWin()
        Checks if the dealer has won or lost. The boolean changes will effect how the program will output the results.

      • checkBJorBust

        public java.lang.String checkBJorBust()
        This checks the user's hand to see if he has won or lost.
        Returns:
        The current state of the game to the game gui.

      • dealerStand

        public void dealerStand()
        When the stand button is pressed, this method will call the remaining cards that the dealer must have.

      • resetGame

        public void resetGame()
        Resets game back to start, clears arrays.

      • drawDealerStartHand

        public void drawDealerStartHand()
        Draws the dealers 2 start cards

      • drawUserStartHand

        public void drawUserStartHand()
        Draws the user's 2 start cards
